Pre-Game Insights: The Miami Heat take on the Houston Rockets in a non-conference matchup.
The Rockets are 11-4 on their home court.
The Heat are 6-9 on the road.
Miami averages 12.4 turnovers per game and is 8-8 when winning the turnover battle.
The Rockets are shooting 44.4% from the field this season, 1.8 percentage points lower than the 46.2% the Heat allow to opponents.
The Heat average 14.5 made 3-pointers per game this season, 2.3 more made shots on average than the 12.2 per game the Rockets allow.
Alperen Sengun is averaging 19 points, 10.6 rebounds and 5.1 assists for the Rockets.
Tyler Herro is scoring 23.9 points per game and averaging 5.7 rebounds for the Heat.

In their last 10 games, the Rockets are 6-4, averaging 110.9 points, 49.0 rebounds, 21.0 assists, 7.3 steals and 5.4 blocks per game while shooting 45.3% from the field. Their opponents have averaged 107.4 points per game.

In their last 10 games, the Heat are 6-4, averaging 113.5 points, 43.6 rebounds, 25.7 assists, 8.9 steals and 3.6 blocks per game while shooting 47.8% from the field. Their opponents have averaged 107.4 points.
Rockets injuries: Dillon Brooks (day to day, ankle), Tari Eason (day to day, rest).
Heat injuries: Dru Smith (out for season, achilles), Josh Richardson (day to day, heel), Jimmy Butler (day to day, illness).
